channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2024040578
item.description:
Report E-2024040578

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XBO experienced a UN2810 XL-Dri release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of product released to the metal drum lid only due to a loose bung cap. The cap was tightened and secured for shipment on. The released product was collected with absorbents. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040612
item.description:
Report E-2024040612

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XBO experienced a UN3260 “Caroat” release from (3) 55-pound plastic bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bags and all released material were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All remaining bags were restacked and secured for shipment on. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040883
item.description:
Report X-2024040883

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was reported to QA that it sounded like the contents was loose and shifting. package was put in a hazmat bag and tote and brought back to the QA desk for inspection. DescribePack: It was found that there were no signs of damage or leakage on the outer box however, an inspection of the inner plastic pail reveled that the bottom was cracked and leaking. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Contents was transferred to a hazmat bag and drum.
